result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:45 PM Defendant Eric Joseph Escallier in court, in custody appearing by video with attorney Walter Isaacson appearing by video..  Cheniqua White   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified.  Cash bond set of $250.00   with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No intentional contact with hospital staff members A.A., S.F., T.S. or B.W.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance March 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
